content.question:
A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at any time t ≥ 0 is given by v(t) = 3t2 − 2t − 1. The position x(t) is 5 for t = 2.

(a) Write a polynomial expression for the position of the particle at any time t ≥ 0.

frqParts.text:
A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at any time t ≥ 0 is given by v(t) = 3t2 − 2t − 1. The position x(t) is 5 for t = 2.

(a) Write a polynomial expression for the position of the particle at any time t ≥ 0.
(b) For what values of t, 0 ≤ t ≤ 3, is the particle's instantaneous velocity the same as its average velocity on the closed interval [0,3]?
(c) Find the total distance traveled by the particle from time t = 0 until time t = 3.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
